edu.udel.cis.vsl.sarl.simplify.IF

Interface RangeFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntervalUnionFactory

    public interface RangeFactory
    Factory for producing instances of Range.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • emptySet

        Range emptySet(boolean isIntegral)
        Returns an empty number set of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        isIntegral - is this integer type (not real type)?
        Returns:
        empty set of integer type if isIntegral is true, else empty set of real type

      • singletonSet

        Range singletonSet(Number number)
        Returns the number set consisting of the single specified element. The type of number determines the type of the set.
        Parameters:
        number - a non-null Number
        Returns:
        singleton set containing number

      • interval

        Range interval(Number left,
             boolean strictLeft,
             Number right,
             boolean strictRight,
             boolean isIntegral)

        Returns the set consisting of all x between left and right.

        Either end-point may be null. A null left end-point is interpreted as negative infinity. A null right end-point is interpreted as positive infinity. If an end-point is null, the corresponding "strict" argument must be true.

        If isIntegral is true, then both left and right must be instances of IntegerNumber (this includes the possibility of null ). If isIntegral is false, both must be instances of RationalNumber.

        Parameters:
        left - the left end-point of the interval
        strictLeft - is the left inequality strict? If true then only x strictly greater than the left end-point may be included in the set
        right - the right end-point of the interval
        strictRight - is the right inequality strict? If true, then only x strictly less than the right end-point may be included in the set
        isIntegral - does the set have integer type (not real type)?
        Returns:
        the set representing the interval of numbers

      • add

        Range add(Range lRange,
        Range rRange)
        For two range rSet and rSet, this function will calculate the summary for those two range and return the result.
        Parameters:
        lRange - a number set of the same type (integer/real) as the other one
        rRange - a number set of the same type (integer/real) as the other one
        Returns:
        the range of the lSet adding the rSet

      • multiply

             Range rRange)
        Parameters:
        lRange - a number set of the same type (integer/real) as the other one
        rRange - a number set of the same type (integer/real) as the other one
        Returns:

      • power

        Range power(Range lRange,
          int exp)
        Parameters:
        lRange - a number set of the same type (integer/real) as the other one
        exp - a natural number as exponent
        Returns:
